17  package com.okta.sdk.impl.cache;
18  
19  import com.okta.sdk.cache.Cache;
20  import com.okta.sdk.cache.CacheManager;
21  import com.okta.sdk.impl.util.SoftHashMap;
22  import com.okta.sdk.lang.Assert;
23  import com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration;
24  import org.slf4j.Logger;
25  import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
26  
27  import java.util.Collection;
28  import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
29  import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap;
30  import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
31  
32  /**
33   * Very simple default {@code CacheManager} implementation that retains all created {@link Cache Cache} instances in
34   * an in-memory {@link ConcurrentMap ConcurrentMap}.  By default, this implementation creates thread-safe
35   * {@link DefaultCache} instances via the {@link #createCache(String) createCache(name)} method, but this can be overridden
36   * by subclasses that wish to provide different Cache implementations.
37   * <h1>Clustering</h1>
38   * <b>This implementation DOES NOT SUPPORT CLUSTERING</b>.
39   * <p>
40   * If your application is deployed on multiple hosts, it is
41   * <em>strongly</em> recommended that you configure the Okta SDK with a clustered {@code CacheManager}
42   * implementation so all of your application instances can utilize the same cache policy and see the same
43   * security/identity data.  Some example clusterable caching projects: Hazelcast, Ehcache+Terracotta, Coherence,
44   * GigaSpaces, etc.
45   * <p>
46   * <b>This implementation is production-quality, but only recommended for single-node/single-JVM applications.</b>
47   * <h2>Time To Idle</h2>
48   * Time to Idle is the amount of time a cache entry may be idle - unused (not accessed) - before it will expire and
49   * no longer be available.  If a cache entry is not accessed at all after this amount of time, it will be
50   * removed from the cache as soon as possible.
51   * <p>
52   * This implementation's {@link #setDefaultTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) defaultTimeToIdle}
53   * is {@code null}, which means that cache entries can potentially remain idle indefinitely.  Note however that a
54   * cache entry can still be expunged due to other conditions (e.g. memory constraints, Time to Live setting, etc).
55   * <p>
56   * The {@link #setDefaultTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) defaultTimeToIdle} setting is only
57   * applied to newly created {@code Cache} instances.  It does not affect already existing {@code Cache}s.
58   * <h2>Time to Live</h2>
59   * Time to Live is the amount of time a cache entry may exist after first being created before it will expire and no
60   * longer be available.  If a cache entry ever becomes older than this amount of time (regardless of how often
61   * it is accessed), it will be removed from the cache as soon as possible.
62   * <p>
63   * This implementation's {@link #setDefaultTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) defaultTimeToLive}
64   * is {@code null}, which means that cache entries could potentially live indefinitely.  Note however that a
65   * cache entry can still be expunged due to other conditions (e.g. memory constraints, Time to Idle setting, etc).
66   * <p>
67   * The {@link #setDefaultTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) defaultTimeToLive} setting is only
68   * applied to newly created {@code Cache} instances.  It does not affect already existing {@code Cache}s.
69   * <h2>Thread Safety</h2>
70   * This implementation and the cache instances it creates are thread-safe and usable in concurrent environments.
71   *
72   * @see #setDefaultTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
73   * @see #setDefaultTimeToIdleSeconds(long)
74   * @see #setDefaultTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration)
75   * @see #setDefaultTimeToLiveSeconds(long)
76   * @since 0.5.0
77   */
78  public class DefaultCacheManager implements CacheManager {
79  
80      private final Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(DefaultCacheManager.class);
81      /**
82       * Retains any region-specific configuration that might be used when creating Cache instances.
83       */
84      private final ConcurrentMap<String, CacheConfiguration> configs;
85  
86      /**
87       * Retains all Cache objects maintained by this cache manager.
88       */
89      protected final ConcurrentMap<String, Cache> caches;
90  
91      private volatile Duration defaultTimeToLive;
92      private volatile Duration defaultTimeToIdle;
93  
94      /**
95       * Default no-arg constructor that instantiates an internal name-to-cache {@code ConcurrentMap}.
96       */
97      public DefaultCacheManager() {
98          this.configs = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
99          this.caches = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
100     }
101 
102     /**
103      * Returns the default {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToLive() timeToLive} duration
104      * to apply to newly created {@link DefaultCache} instances.  This setting does not affect existing
105      * {@link DefaultCache} instances.
106      *
107      * @return the default {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToLive() timeToLive} duration
108      *         to apply to newly created {@link DefaultCache} instances.
109      * @see DefaultCache
110      * @see DefaultCache#getTimeToLive()
111      */
112     public Duration getDefaultTimeToLive() {
113         return defaultTimeToLive;
114     }
115 
116     /**
117      * Sets the default {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToLive() timeToLive} duration
118      * to apply to newly created {@link DefaultCache} instances.  This setting does not affect existing
119      * {@link DefaultCache} instances.
120      *
121      * @param defaultTimeToLive the default {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToLive() timeToLive}
122      *                          duration to apply to newly created {@link DefaultCache} instances.
123      */
124     public void setDefaultTimeToLive(Duration defaultTimeToLive) {
125         DefaultCache.assertTtl(defaultTimeToLive);
126         this.defaultTimeToLive = defaultTimeToLive;
127     }
128 
129     /**
130      * Convenience method that sets the {@link #setDefaultTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) defaultTimeToLive}
131      * value using a {@code TimeUnit} of {@link TimeUnit#SECONDS}.
132      *
133      * @param seconds the {@link #setDefaultTimeToLive(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) defaultTimeToLive} value in seconds.
134      */
135     public void setDefaultTimeToLiveSeconds(long seconds) {
136         setDefaultTimeToLive(new Duration(seconds, TimeUnit.SECONDS));
137     }
138 
139     /**
140      * Returns the default {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToIdle() timeToIdle} duration
141      * to apply to newly created {@link DefaultCache} instances.  This setting does not affect existing
142      * {@link DefaultCache} instances.
143      *
144      * @return the default {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToIdle() timeToIdle} duration
145      *         to apply to newly created {@link DefaultCache} instances.
146      */
147     public Duration getDefaultTimeToIdle() {
148         return defaultTimeToIdle;
149     }
150 
151     /**
152      * Sets the default {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToIdle() timeToIdle} duration
153      * to apply to newly created {@link DefaultCache} instances.  This setting does not affect existing
154      * {@link DefaultCache} instances.
155      *
156      * @param defaultTimeToIdle the default {@link DefaultCache#getTimeToIdle() timeToIdle}
157      *                          duration to apply to newly created {@link DefaultCache} instances.
158      */
159     public void setDefaultTimeToIdle(Duration defaultTimeToIdle) {
160         DefaultCache.assertTti(defaultTimeToIdle);
161         this.defaultTimeToIdle = defaultTimeToIdle;
162     }
163 
164     /**
165      * Convenience method that sets the {@link #setDefaultTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) defaultTimeToIdle}
166      * value using a {@code TimeUnit} of {@link TimeUnit#SECONDS}.
167      *
168      * @param seconds the {@link #setDefaultTimeToIdle(com.okta.sdk.lang.Duration) defaultTimeToIdle} value in seconds.
169      */
170     public void setDefaultTimeToIdleSeconds(long seconds) {
171         setDefaultTimeToIdle(new Duration(seconds, TimeUnit.SECONDS));
172     }
173 
174     /**
175      * Sets cache-specific configuration entries, to be utilized when creating cache instances.
176      *
177      * @param configs cache-specific configuration entries, to be utilized when creating cache instances.
178      */
179     public void setCacheConfigurations(Collection<CacheConfiguration> configs) {
180         Assert.notNull("Argument cannot be null.  To remove all configuration, set an empty collection.");
181         this.configs.clear();
182 
183         for (CacheConfiguration config : configs) {
184             this.configs.put(config.getName(), config);
185         }
186     }
187 
188     /**
189      * Returns the cache with the specified {@code name}.  If the cache instance does not yet exist, it will be lazily
190      * created, retained for further access, and then returned.
191      *
192      * @param name the name of the cache to acquire.
193      * @return the cache with the specified {@code name}.
194      * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the {@code name} argument is {@code null} or does not contain text.
195      */
196     public <K, V> Cache<K, V> getCache(String name) throws IllegalArgumentException {
197         Assert.hasText(name, "Cache name cannot be null or empty.");
198 
199         Cache cache;
200 
201         cache = caches.get(name);
202         if (cache == null) {
203             logger.debug("Creating cache '{}'", name);
204 
205             cache = createCache(name);
206             Cache existing = caches.putIfAbsent(name, cache);
207             if (existing != null) {
208                 cache = existing;
209             }
210         }
211 
212         //noinspection unchecked
213         return cache;
214     }
215 
216     /**
217      * Creates a new {@code Cache} instance associated with the specified {@code name}.
218      *
219      * @param name the name of the cache to create
220      * @return a new {@code Cache} instance associated with the specified {@code name}.
221      */
222     @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
223     protected Cache createCache(String name) {
224         Duration ttl = this.defaultTimeToLive != null ? this.defaultTimeToLive.clone() : null;
225         Duration tti = this.defaultTimeToIdle != null ? this.defaultTimeToIdle.clone() : null;
226 
227         CacheConfiguration config = this.configs.get(name);
228         if (config != null) {
229             Duration d = config.getTimeToLive();
230             if (d != null) {
231                 ttl = d;
232             }
233             d = config.getTimeToIdle();
234             if (d != null) {
235                 tti = d;
236             }
237         }
238 
239         return new DefaultCache(name, new SoftHashMap(), ttl, tti);
240     }
241 
242     public String toString() {
243         Collection<Cache> values = caches.values();
244         StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder()
245                 .append("{\n")
246                 .append("  \"cacheCount\": ").append(caches.size()).append(",\n")
247                 .append("  \"defaultTimeToLive\": \"").append(toString(defaultTimeToLive)).append("\",\n")
248                 .append("  \"defaultTimeToIdle\": \"").append(toString(defaultTimeToIdle)).append("\",\n")
249                 .append("  \"caches\": [");
250 
251         if (!caches.isEmpty()) {
252             sb.append("\n");
253             int i = 0;
254             for (Cache cache : values) {
255                 if (i > 0) {
256                     sb.append(",\n");
257                 }
258                 sb.append(cache.toString());
259                 i++;
260             }
261             sb.append("\n  ");
262         }
263 
264         sb.append("]\n}");
265         return sb.toString();
266     }
267 
268     private String toString(Duration d) {
269         return d != null ? d.toString() : "indefinite";
270     }
271 }
